Name: Art Library
Details: Enjoy life from a new perspective. Find out what's happening in the world of art and design - from cave paintings to the Turner Prize, from early pottery to the latest trends in architecture, fashion and photography.

Name: Central Children's Library
Details: Explore a wide choice of stories, old and new, together with lots of picture books for younger readers. Not forgetting our DVDs. We also have excellent books to help with school projects and hobbies. Join in with our storytimes and rhymetimes, and keep an eye out for our other children’s events held throughout the year.

Opening hours: Mon - Wed: 10am - 8pm, Thu - Sat: 10am - 5pm
Bookbug Sessions: A free event for 0 to 4 year olds and their parents/carers. Every Tuesday and Friday 10.30 - 11.00am
Book groups: The Dyslexia Chatterbooks group meets on the last Tuesday of the month at 6.30pm. Contact us for details.
Other events:
Free story time for 3 - 5 year olds. Every Thursday from 10.30am
Friday crafts for ages 7-11. Weekly, 2-3pm

Name: Central Lending Library
News:
We’ve discovered a structural problem with an area of central library that is not open to the public.
We’ve closed this area to staff while checks are carried out. Until these checks are complete, and remedial work carried out staff cannot fetch any of the classic fiction and non fiction works which are normally stored in this area. This also includes some of our audio books. 
We’re sorry for any inconvenience caused. Please speak to staff to see if alternatives can be arranged.
Details: High interest rates guaranteed with a great and varied collection of all the latest titles plus old favourites.    Choose from a wide range of fact and fiction including collections of travel books, language courses, maps and DVDs. Our friendly staff are always on hand to help and advise you with selection.   Don't forget to look out for our topical displays and themed events.

Name: Edinburgh and Scottish Collection
News:
We’ve discovered a structural problem with an area of central library that is not open to the public.
We’ve closed this area to staff while checks are carried out. Until these checks are complete and remedial work carried out staff cannot fetch any of the books or other material stored in this space. This includes most of our material relating to Edinburgh, including Valuation Rolls and Electoral Registers, as well as our older Scottish material. 
We’re sorry for any inconvenience caused. Please speak to staff to see if alternatives can be arranged.
Details: The place to find out about Scotland and its capital. Fantastic heritage collections cover history, maps, literature, local and family history as well as up to date information about your local area.

English Classes: ESOL Classes are available from Edinburgh college. They take place in our library every Wednesday and Thursday. If you wish to book a place on these  courses you need to contact Duncan Place. Tel: 0131 535 4630 Email: caroline.battes@edinburghcollege.ac.uk We have ESOL Crisis English classes from 1pm to 3pm on Thursdays, you are welcome to turn up on the day without appointment.
Book groups:
Join Anna for her book group of fantastic fiction last Monday of every month at 6.30-7.30pm. Contact the library as there may be a waiting list. 
The 'Found in Translation' group for contemporary European literature translated into English meets every 3rd Monday of the month at 6pm - contact the library to put your name down.
We also run an ESOL reading group: 'Chatabout' on the last Thursday of the month from 10.30 - 11.30am. Contact wendy.pearson@edinburgh.gov.uk or call 0131 242 8022 for details
Our independent book group with Chris and friends, new members are welcome. Please get in touch via email: edinburghbookgroup@gmail.com

Name: Mobile Libraries
Details:
The mobile library service offers a window to the full range of library services. You can join on board and choose from a wide range of books for children and adults. There are over 2,000 books and talking books to choose from - or request any of our 500,000 loan items for free and collect them on your next visit.
All of our mobile library buses are fully accessible and wheelchair friendly.
Facebook: Find your nearest mobile library stop
Libraries home page: <a href="http://www.edinburgh.gov.uk/libraries" rel="nofollow">Find out all about libraries including borrowing, reserving and renewing books

Name: Music Library
News:
We’ve discovered a structural problem with an area of central library that is not open to the public.
We’ve closed this area to staff while checks are carried out. Until these checks are complete and remedial work carried out staff cannot fetch music scores, older CDs and DVDs or other material stored in this space.
We’re sorry for any inconvenience caused. Please speak to staff to see if alternatives can be arranged.
Details:
The Music Library contains the largest collection of publicly accessible material on music and dance in Scotland. Whether you need help identifying a piece of music or want to take up the didgeridoo, expert staff are on hand to help.
We also offer music streaming, a soundproof pod, and a digital piano.
Facebook: Catch up with the latest news on our Facebook page
Opening hours: Mon - Wed: 10am - 8pm, Thu - Sat: 10am - 5pm
Libraries home page: <a href="http://www.edinburgh.gov.uk/libraries" rel="nofollow">Find out all about libraries including borrowing, reserving and renewing books

Name: Reference Library
News:
We’ve discovered a structural problem with an area of central library that is not open to the public.
We’ve closed this area to staff while checks are carried out and remedial work carried out. Until these checks are complete staff cannot fetch any of the books or other material stored in this space. 
We’re sorry for any inconvenience caused. Please speak to staff to see if alternatives can be arranged.
Details: A collection of a third of a million items,  helpful staff, free internet access and the beautiful surroundings of the reading room make the reference library the ideal place for information, research, study or just relaxing in peaceful contemplation. Contact us with your enquiry or visit us to browse the collection and use our study facilities - including free wi-fi.
